messages.subject: On Halloween (Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Satanic t-shirts/Halloween)
messages.msgSnippet: Interesting article on the merits of Halloween in Christianity Today: SNIP: Christians should instead celebrate Halloween with gusto. If we follow the
messages.messageBody:
Interesting article on the merits of Halloween in Christianity
Today:

SNIP:
Christians should instead celebrate Halloween with gusto. If we
follow the traditional formula of having a good time at his
expense, Satan flees.

In any event, I doubt the anti-Halloween party will prevail. This
tactic was tried before-with Christmas. In the 17th century,
because of its pagan ancestry and because it was a Roman Catholic
holiday (Christ-mass!), many Protestants decided that true
believers should not recognize Christmas. In 1620 our pilgrim
forefathers purposely started unloading the Mayflower on
Christmas Day to make the point to the crew that they were not
going to observe such an evil day.

LINK:
http://www.christianitytoday.com/ct/2000/011/29.79.html


----- Original Message -----
From: "Joseph Fuerst" <fuerst@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 29, 2002 4:05 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Satanic t-shirts/Halloween


| > Of course I have my own belif that some of the anti-Halloween
stuff is
| really anti-Catholic stuff (ala Chick tracts) in
disquise...they just don't
| want to admit it. JMHO and really just a feeling I get.
| >
| > Julie W in AR
| >
| Finally, someone admits it's anti-Catholic!! <g> So many
Catholics I know
| absolutely LOVE Halloween.....me included.
| Susan
